result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn J Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100.00 cash bond applied. Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

Must continue to comply with mental health assessment and any recommended follow-up treatment. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA to be mailed to the defendant. Must report to the Barron County Jail Monday-Friday, between 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM, to submit DNA sample, by 4 PM on Friday 10/21/22.

Must have no contact with J.E.K. 
Must have no contact with Marketplace Foods in Rice Lake.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 1 day credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn J Norman

22CF190
Count 1-Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. State and Defense waive PSI. Court questions Defendant.  Court grants waiver.
State relates.
Attorney Erdman relates.

Court relates and orders:
